title: Ticket #3339: manual description of parallel universe needs improvement
description:
From Sam F, the start of suggestions for improved prose:

\subsection*{Parallel Universe: Clusters, Processes, and Subprocesses} When a user submits a job to HTCondor with \verb=condor_submit=, HTCondor in Parallel Universe processes the submit file and assumes that all jobs submitted in this file are part of a parallel (e.g.~MPI) job. HTCondor processes the job and creates a new cluster with a new clusterID for the job. The user though can specify different requirements for different parts of the job and queue each part separately with each part being part of the same cluster but receiving a different ProcID (process ID). Within each processes, the user (by using partitionable slots) can also request more than one CPU (\verb+num_cpus = 2+). Each request for a slot is known as a subprocess; each subprocess has the same cluster ID and proc ID as the over-arching process but has its own unique subprocID (or whatever the actual name is).

The way to create multiple processes is to place a number after the \verb=queue= command, such as \verb=queue 8= to create eight different processes with the same cluster. After a particular \verb=queue= command, the user can also change parameters previously specified in the submit file or add parameters not previously specified. For example, suppose that the head node of a parallel job needs additional RAM compared to the rest of the nodes. The user can write 

    request_memory = 5G
    queue
    request_meory = 1G
    queue 31

If a user wishes to submit multiple independent Parallel Universe jobs, the user cannot simply append a number to the \verb=queue= command. HTCondor will assume that each job is not independent -- as by definition, a parallel job is a job is at least setup to handle multiple (sub)processes.
